name: Smoky Baked Beans
description: Classic baked beans with a sweet, tangy, and smoky flavor profile, slow-cooked with bacon and molasses.
prepTime: 15 minutes (+ optional overnight soak for dried beans)
cookTime: 2.5-3.5 hours (depending on bean type and tenderness desired)

ingredients.name: Dried Navy Beans
ingredients.notes: Approx 45g. OR 1/2 can (7.5 oz) canned beans, drained & rinsed

ingredients.name: Water
ingredients.notes: Approx 5 tbsp, or more as needed

instructions: Prepare Dried Beans (if using): Soak dried beans overnight. Drain, rinse, add to a pot, cover with fresh water, bring to boil. Simmer ~1 hour until tender. Drain. (Skip this step if using canned beans).

Cook Bacon & Veggies: In an oven-proof pot/Dutch oven, cook diced bacon over medium heat until starting to crisp. Remove half the bacon, set aside. Sauté onion and garlic in remaining bacon fat until translucent.
Add Flavors: Stir in molasses, BBQ sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, Dijon, Worcestershire, smoked paprika, black pepper, and optional cayenne. Mix well.
Combine & Add Water: Add pre-cooked dried beans OR drained canned beans to the pot. Pour in water (0.3 cup per serving) or enough to just cover beans. Stir to coat.
Bake: Preheat oven to 325°F (163°C). Cover pot and bake for 2-3 hours. Check periodically; add more water if beans look dry. Remove lid for the last 30 mins to thicken sauce.
Finish & Serve: Remove from oven when beans are thick and flavors melded. Stir in reserved crispy bacon. Taste and adjust salt/pepper. Serve hot.
cookNotes: Soaking dried beans is recommended for even cooking, but not strictly necessary if simmering longer.
Using canned beans significantly reduces total cooking time.
Baking time can vary; cook until beans reach desired tenderness and sauce thickness.
Adjust molasses and brown sugar for desired sweetness.
